Job Title: Senior .NET Application Developer

Location: Jackson, MS

REMOTE

Job Description
The Mississippi Department of Education has a current goal for every community to effectively use a World-Class Data System to improve student outcomes. This goal has an outcome to increase the availability of quality data to drive decisions that improve student outcomes. We are planning to satisfy this goal in part by modernizing our current student information system along with improving the quality of data in connected systems. This position will require a qualified Web App Developers to take the lead in the following tasks:
• Designing applications
• Creating applications
• Coding applications
• Updating applications
• Testing products for functionality and errors

Preference given to candidates with the below skills/experience. Must also meet minimum requirements.
Experience with student information management systems and K-12 data and reporting is a plus
DevOps principles, and cloud architecture is a plus

REQUIRED SKILLS/EXPERIENCE
Knowledge of multiple front-end languages and libraries (e.g. HTML/ CSS, JavaScript, XML, jQuery)
Hands-on experience working as a React.js developer - 10 years
Knowledge of multiple back-end languages (e.g. C#, Java, Python) and JavaScript frameworks (e.g. Angular, React, Node.js) - 10 years
Hands on experience working in Azure DevOps, Utilizing pipelines - 10 years
Familiarity with application design, documentation, and coding - 10 years
Experience working in Agile Team - 5 years
GitHub - 10 years
Familiarity with databases (e.g. MySQL, MongoDB), web services and UI/UX design
Knowledge of Azure functions and Application Insight
